intro: Pseudoconyza lyrata, commonly known as the lyreleaf false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are lyre-shaped, with a distinctive lobed structure, and its flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Pseudoconyza lyrata is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
